qas.question: When was the Western Electric System introduced?
What two companies worked together to develop the Western Electric System?

answers.text: Bell Telephone Laboratories and Western Electric

qas.question: What system was used by Warner Brothers?
What speed was used in the Western Electric System?
What was the Western Electric System believed to do?

context: There were important quality advances in recordings specifically made for radio broadcast. In the <a0_0>early 1930s<a0_0/> <a1_0>Bell Telephone Laboratories and Western Electric<a1_0/> announced the total reinvention of disc recording: the Western Electric Wide Range System, "The New Voice of Action". The intent of the new <a2_0>Western Electric system<a2_0/> was to <a4_0>improve the overall quality<a4_0/> of disc recording and playback. The recording speed was <a3_0>33 1⁄3 rpm<a3_0/>, originally used in the Western Electric/ERPI movie audio disc system implemented in the early Warner Brothers' Vitaphone "talkies" of 1927.
